TVMLKit provides a JavaScript environment to create apps that uses the familiar powerful underlying frameworks to render UI, like UIKit and QuartzCore, to deliver an experience that looks and feels like an Apple developed app. The API set consists of a rich markup called TVML to describe user interface and a set of highly functional JavaScript classes and functions required to write a client-server app for delivering media content through 10 foot experience. A TVMLKit engineer will work with technologies like, JavaScriptCore, XML, multithreading, UIKit, AVKit, etc. and will invent and implement algorithms to complex problems.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Location-based Intelligence
location: Santa Clara Valley (Cupertino), California, United States
minimum_qual:
Real passion for the location domain. We believe that mobility is transformative, and that to realize that transformation, your devices need to understand the places you go and what they mean to you. That’s what we do. If you have experience in location estimation—GPS/GNSS, WiFi positioning, indoor localization, or discrete localization—we're especially eager to speak with you.
5+ years experience developing commercial software. Most of the code you write will run on mobile devices, in the hands of hundreds of millions of Apple customers. We use Objective-C, but if you know C, modern C++, or Swift, you shouldn’t have a problem.
A working knowledge of statistics fundamentals. Your code will make estimates, identify patterns, and quantify how strong they are. You should be comfortable using histograms, basic probability, and Bayes’s Theorem. If you have a background in signal processing, data science, or machine learning, that's even better.
An ability to evaluate and optimize for system performance: memory, CPU, radios, etc. Our software needs to provide a high level of service while sipping power. We think this is a really exciting challenge. If it sounds frustrating to you, this isn’t the right position.
A proven track record working effectively across teams. One of the cool things about Apple is how much you will work with people who have different expertise and responsibilities than you: apps, sensors, connectivity, and others. You’ll need to communicate clearly, plan collaboratively, execute flexibly, and cope with what will sometimes feel like a high degree of uncertainty.
Experience processing real-world data at scale, server-side. Not every candidate will have experience with Spark, Hadoop, or NoSQL data stores, but the best ones will.
responsibilities:
In this job, you’ll develop the next frontier of mobile technology, in partnership with teams in sensing, Siri, and apps. Hungry for the responsibility to work on complex problems from end to end? In this position, you will:

-  Conceptualize, explore, and define new inferential and predictive location- and motion-based capabilities for Apple's platforms.

-  Collect, curate, and analyze real-world data sets of varying size and complexity.

-  Aggregate, filter, and cluster data on mobile devices, from a variety of local sensors: GPS, WiFi, accelerometer, and others. 

-  Design and implement algorithms, then integrate them into production code.

-  Test your work. Dog-food it. Collect metrics, and iterate. Don’t forget to sweat the edge cases—an issue that impacts 1% of a billion devices is a big issue.

A dedication to users’ privacy and security is core to how Apple does business. We want their devices to exhibit the high level of intelligence and proactivity that can only come from deep contextual understanding. We don’t want their sensitive data coming back to Apple or being exposed to third parties. Other companies solve similar problems in very different ways. Our way is more work. We believe it’s worth it.

responsibilities:
Customers’ security, privacy, and safety are very important to Apple. Your job will be to analyze our products and attempt to break them in ways that could undermine these goals, especially when the attacker is in possession of the Apple device or in close proximity to it (connecting over WiFi, BT, RFID). In order to do that, you will be required to:

Take a system or sub-system and find ways to overcome the defence mechanisms that have been implemented in hardware and low-level software. 
Examine new Apple silicon security features and prove if/how they can be defeated. 
Examine embedded systems and find security vulnerabilities in Apple or 3rd party silicon and firmware, including in the interfaces between components. 
Analyze a system to understand the potential threats and attack vectors
Stay abreast of modern hacking techniques against Apple products, particularly those where the attacker is in close proximity or possession of the device.
education&experience: Bachelor/Masters in Engineering/Computer Science, and/or proven track record as a security researcher/analyst

A Hardware Systems Architect for Apple Watch has core strengths in several functional areas of responsibility and system design. The position empowers you to lead and drive system technical roadmaps. 

We expect you to oversee and analyze key systems engineering architectural and implementation trade-offs; design of high performance, low power, high quality products; developing pre-net list PCB floor plan feasibility considering package, SI, EMC, and RF issues for place and route guidance; power budgeting and analysis. 

The role requires strong communication, persuasion, and negotiation skills. You will have the opportunity to mentor other engineers for the best standards, methodologies, and practices in systems development and institutionalized processes. Other responsibilities include:

-  Review, challenge, and creatively influence product roadmaps across groups.

-  We work with cross and multi-functional engineering managers and architects on hardware and software-enabling technologies. 

-  Build internal and external system specifications. 

-  Keep current with cutting edge technology trends and vendor roadmaps.

-  Review, influence, and challenge system performance decisions with new ideas. 

-  Define, simulate, and model product performance vs. power (performance per watt). 

-  Specify, negotiate, and document system power management and user level behaviors. 

-  Define, develop, and utilize tools, scripts, and methods of system analysis. 

-  Guide early system layout studies. 

-  Partner closely with Mechanical Engineering and Industrial Design.

-  Assess and guide product system integration feasibility, feature and implementation trade-offs of early layout studies. 

-  Utilize schematic and layout tools such as Cadence Concept & Allegro; develop new and novel methods of pre-route guidance.

-  Periodically join hands-on prototype bring-up and debugging efforts as needed on a project-by-project basis.

You will work with us from Apple's headquarters in Cupertino, California and participate in domestic and international travel.

responsibilities:

1) Core architecture and technology investigation by arbitrating various options with technical rigor for key power metric performance optimization including but not limited to performance, power consumption, silicon and board area, cost and scalability.

20) Spearhead innovation through exemplary behavior and teamwork.

title: Mechanical Engineer
location: Nanshan, Guangdong, China
minimum_qual:
We are looking for you with
- 5 plus years in an engineering role with experience in product design, Quality as well as design for manufacturability or manufacturing engineering
- Solid working knowledge of DFx (DFM, DFA) as well as quality tools and techniques with new product introduction and Manufacturing Operations experience in volume production
- Strong background on plastic mold injection, metal chassis stamping, and mechanical parts assembly
- Rich knowledge of GD&T, metrology design, 6 sigma, failure analysis
- Understanding on tolerance stack up analysis
- Hands on experience taking care of process capability analysis, GRR, cross-cavity check and Process qualification
- Deep experience in measurement techniques and high skill level to handle actual measurement tools equipment – OMM, CMM, jig design
- Good command of excels, Minitab or JMP sw.
- Preferred work experiences in LCD back light area. Basic understanding of adhesives, PSA’s and VHB’s a plus.
- Working knowledge of pneumatics, servomotors, PLC and PC-based control systems and clean room set up a plus.
We are expecting you to
- Responsible for manufacturing research and development to solve complex problems that have direct impact to final product cost, quality and delivery of Apple products. Under broad goals and objectives, exercises discernment within general defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions to complex problems.
- To manage mechanical parts vendors for mold injection parts, metal chassis stamping process and secondary processes like laser welding and other innovative assembly processes.
- Involvement may begin at any step from concept phase to Mass production.
- Metrology design review with vendor to ensure Vendor understood the design intent and fulfill data collection request.
- Compiles and evaluates test and measurement data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specifications.
- May conceive and plan projects involving definition and selection of new concepts, equipment automation technology, and approaches in the processing or development of new or improved processes.
- Map out quality control plan from prototype stage up to full production.
- Sets standard practices and independently determines impact to design approaches and parameters to the final product.
- Develop new and or improved processes through the application of theoretical and practical engineering.
- Applies extensive expertise in all facets of mechanical product design.
- Provides direction, mentorship and resources to other engineering groups and project leaders as well as factory technicians. Act as lead engineer on a variety of projects and participates in the project planning of major sub-projects.
- Keeps abreast of all meaningful technical trends and developments and incorporates them in appropriate assignments.
- Performs assignments in several of the following manufacturing engineering functions:
- Design for Manufacturability - Provide early and on going manufacturing involvement to ensure new products are mechanically manufacturable.
- Failure/Data Analysis - Plans, develops and implements technically complex procedures for the testing and evaluation of soon to be released products. Specifies test to be performed, compiles data and makes recommendations for product design changes and final assembly standards. This will include the use of Design of Experiments (DOE) and statistical analysis using Six Sigma principles.
